de.nec.nle.siafu.graphics
Class Markers

java.lang.Object
  de.nec.nle.siafu.graphics.Markers

public class Markers
extends Object

Instances of this class encapsulate the marks in the simulator.

A track mark is a visual cue that allows the GUI users to follow an agent, or identify a place. To faciliate managing marks from external applications, external tracks are kept separate from internal ones, so that fiddling with the GUI won't alter what your application is trying to display, and vice-versa.

Author:
Miquel Martin

Method Detail

isTracked

public boolean isTracked(Trackable trackable,
                         Markers.Type type)
Check if a given Trackable is being tracked in the GUI at the moment.

Parameters:
trackable - the Trackable we want to check
type - the type of Track, which can be any of Markers.Type
Returns:
true if the object is being tracked for that track type, false otherwise

isTracked

public boolean isTracked(Trackable trackable)
This method is equal to isTracked(Trackable,Type), but does not discriminate types. If the trackable has any type of mark, true is returned.

Parameters:
trackable - the trackable to check
Returns:
true if the trackable has any type of mark

addMarker

public void addMarker(Marker mark,
                      Markers.Type type)
Tracks a Trackable in the GUI using a Marker of the class provided in the marker parameter. The marker is stored in the Type list of markers. Only one marker per Type is allowed, which essentially means that each marking source can only keep one tag at a time on the Trackable.

Parameters:
mark - the Marker object to draw
type - the source of the track

removeAllMarkers

public void removeAllMarkers(Markers.Type type)
Clear all the tracks of a given type.

Parameters:
type - the type of tracks to be removed

removeAllMarkers

public void removeAllMarkers()
Clear all marks of all types.

disposeResources

public void disposeResources()
Dispose of all the resources allocated by SWT.

removeMarker

public void removeMarker(Trackable trackable,
                         Markers.Type type)
Remove a track mark for a specific track type and trackable.

Parameters:
trackable - the Trackable we don't want to mark anymore
type - the type of track to remove

removeMarker

public void removeMarker(Trackable trackable)
Remove all marks from a trackable.

Parameters:
trackable - the Trackable we don't want to mark anymore

getMarker

public Marker getMarker(Trackable t,
                        Markers.Type type)
Get the marker of a given type, for a given trackable.

Parameters:
t - the trackable
type - the type
Returns:
the associated marker

geMarks

public Collection<Marker> geMarks(Markers.Type type)
Get the markers of a certain type. Note that there is no guarantee that the map won't change while you are reading. Synchronization is up to the developer. By type, we refer to the category of markers, not the actual look of the marker.

Parameters:
type - an instance of Type
Returns:
a map with the external tracks
